Detailed Description

Converts complex amplitude time samples into 1,2 or 4 Hz data and converts the freq domain values to pixels. Note that the cofficients arrive in half frames. So 512 samples at a time, 1024 values which are real,imaginary,real,imaginary... One full frame is 1024 samples, which is 2048 values (real,imaginary,real,imaginary...)

Definition at line 238 of file WaterfallDisplay.java.

Member Function Documentation

synchronized double [] opensonata.dataDisplays.WaterfallDisplay.CoefConversion.convertCoefsTo1HzFreqValues ( double  newCoef[]  ) 

Convert the 1Hz complex amplitude values to frequency values. This pieces together the last half frame and the current half frame to operate on one full frame. Pipelined.

Parameters:
newCoef the latest half frame.
Returns:
an array of frequency values. Sonce this is pipelined, the first time there is no half frame of coeffiecients stored so a zeroed array is returned.

void opensonata.dataDisplays.WaterfallDisplay.CoefConversion.convertCoefsToFreqValues ( double  coef[]  )  [private]

Convert the complex amplitude time samples to the frequency domain.

Time sample order is real, imag in adjacent array elements

Parameters:
coef the array of complex amplitude time samples. The return values are placed back into the coef[] array.
